org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards

Class CardData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards.PublishableCard
      • org.cyanogenmod.launcher.home.api.cards.CardData

  • public class CardData
extends PublishableCard

    CardData contains data representing a single card that will appear in CM Home. This class allows an application to create new cards, publish them to CM Home, remove them, and receive callbacks when events related to cards occur.

    CardData includes many possible fields, and not all of them are required. The idea is that an extension application can publish whatever data or content they have available, and CM Home will do it's very best to find the best Card UI for the data available. At minimum, a card should have a ContentCreatedDate and a Title. More Card types will be created in the future, so publish as much data as you have, so that they will be used in rich ways within CM Home.

    To publish a new Card to CM Home, just create a new CardData object, set the desired fields, and call PublishableCard.publish(android.content.Context). This publishes your data in the ContentProvider backing CardData and notifies CM Home that a new card is available. To query the currently published cards at any time, use getAllPublishedCardDatas(android.content.Context) to retrieve a list of CardData objects. To remove any card that is currently published, call unpublish(android.content.Context) on that card.

    CardData also contains a list of related images, retrievable in getImages(). Any images that have been added will be published when PublishableCard.publish(android.content.Context) is called on a CardData object.

    See Also:

        Creates a new card that has only a title and content created date.
        Parameters:

        contentCreatedDate - The date that the content this card represents was created.

    • Method Detail

      • addCardDataImage

        public void addCardDataImage(android.net.Uri uri)
        Add a related CardDataImage object to this CardData. Any images added will be considered for display in CM Home as part of this card.
        Parameters:
        uri - A URI to this image (all types, including internet resources, are allowed).

      • addOrUpdateCardDataImage

        public void addOrUpdateCardDataImage(CardDataImage newImage)
        Adds a CardDataImage to this DataCard, if this CardDataImage is not already associated with this image. If a CardDataImage is already associated with this CardData, that instance is removed and replaced with this one.
        Parameters:
        newImage - The CardDataImage instance to add or update.

      • setInternalId

        public void setInternalId(java.lang.String internalId)
        Set an internal ID for use in tracking the card. This should be a unique ID per card, and can be any String. To be used by the app developer to track a Card, as it relates to their own internal data. (e.g. a primary key in a third party database table).
        Parameters:
        internalId - A string with which to identify this Card, unique among other CardData instances.

      • getInternalId

        public java.lang.String getInternalId()
        Retrieves the currently set internal ID for this CardData.
        Returns:
        The internal ID string for this CardData.
        See Also:
        setInternalId(String)

      • addCardDataImage

        public void addCardDataImage(CardDataImage image)

        Adds a new CardDataImage to this CardData. A CardData can be associated with any number of images. When the Card is generated in CM Home, a suitable number of images will be shown, depending on what is supported. For example, you can attach images related to a news article or social media event.

        When this card is published, all added images will be published as well.

        Parameters:
        image - A CardDataImage to add to this CardData.

      • clearImages

        public void clearImages()
        Removes all associated images and unpublishes them immediately.

      • removeCardDataImage

        public void removeCardDataImage(CardDataImage image)
        Removes a CardDataImage from this CardData, if it is currently linked to this CardData. This CardDataImage is also unpublished immediately.
        Parameters:
        image - The CardDataImage to remove from this CardData.

      • getImages

        public java.util.List<CardDataImage> getImages()
        Retrieve a List of all CardDataImages that are linked to this CardData.
        Returns:
        A list of CardDataImages that are linked to this CardData.

      • getCreatedDate

        public java.util.Date getCreatedDate()
        Retrieves a Date object representing the time that this CardData was originally published. If the CardData is unpublished and published again, this will be reset to the most recent publish time. Please note that simply republishing updates to this CardData will not change the CreatedDate value.
        Returns:
        A Date with the time that this CardData was published.

      • getReasonText

        public java.lang.String getReasonText()
        Retrieves the current reason text string for this CardData.
        Returns:
        The currently set text describing the reason this content was displayed.
        See Also:
        setReasonText(String)

      • setReasonText

        public void setReasonText(java.lang.String reason)

        Sets the reason text for this CardData. This optional field is intended to be used to describe why certain content was displayed.

        For example, a news extension might publish a Card to the user for a news article that the user did not explicitly request. The reason text could be: "Suggested because you read about Seattle news in the past."

        Parameters:
        reason - A String describing the reason this card is displayed.

      • getContentCreatedDate

        public java.util.Date getContentCreatedDate()
        Retrieves the currently set Content Created Date.
        Returns:
        A Date representing when this content was created.
        See Also:
        setContentCreatedDate(java.util.Date)

      • setContentCreatedDate

        public void setContentCreatedDate(java.util.Date contentCreatedDate)

        Retrieves the Date representing when this content was created. Please note that this is completely independent of CreatedDate, as this does not necessarily have to be the same time that the card was published.

        For example, if a News extension is publishing a Card for an article. The content created date may be the date the article was written. For a Social Media post, this would be the time at which the post was made by the original author.

        This Date will be prioritized over the created date of the card, if set.

        Parameters:
        contentCreatedDate - The Date that this content was created.

      • getLastModifiedDate

        public java.util.Date getLastModifiedDate()
        Gets the modified date for this CardData. This will be set each time a card is published and any field has changed.

      • getContentSourceImageUri

        public android.net.Uri getContentSourceImageUri()
        Retrieve the Uri that points to the Content Source image.
        Returns:
        A Uri object that will resolve to the image file for the Content Source image.

      • setContentSourceImage

        public void setContentSourceImage(android.net.Uri contentSourceImageUri)

        Sets a Uri that will resolve to an Image to be used to identify the content source.

        For example, a news application could use this image to display a logo representing the news outlet that produced the article.

        Another example is a Social Media extension that aggregates content from multiple sources. This image may display the icon of the Social network where the content originated from.

        Parameters:
        contentSourceImageUri - A URI that resolves to the content source image (all types, including internet resources, are allowed).

      • setContentSourceImage

        public void setContentSourceImage(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)

        Sets a Bitmap that will resolve to an Image to be used to identify the content source.

        When PublishableCard.publish(Context) is called on this CardData, this bitmap is saved to a cache within the internal storage for this application, to be accessed only by CM Home through a ContentProvider. If the same Bitmap is passed for any field, the same cached image will be used.

        Parameters:
        bitmap - A Bitmap to be used as the content source image.
        See Also:
        setContentSourceImage(Uri)

      • setContentSourceImage

        public void setContentSourceImage(int resourceId)

        Sets a resource ID that will resolve to an Image to be used to identify the content source.

        When PublishableCard.publish(Context) is called on this CardData, this resource is saved to a cache within the internal storage for this application, to be accessed only by CM Home through a ContentProvider. If the same Bitmap is passed for any field, the same cached image will be used.

        Parameters:
        resourceId - A resourceId that resolves to the content source image.
        See Also:
        setContentSourceImage(Uri)

        For example, a Social Media extension could use this image to display the profile picture of the user that posted a status update.

        Parameters:

      • setSmallText

        public void setSmallText(java.lang.String smallText)

        Sets a String to use as the "Small Text" for this Card.

        This text will be displayed below or near to the title of this Card. This field can be used for a small piece of identifying information such as the author of an article or the location of a post.

        Parameters:
        smallText - A String that will be displayed in smaller text near the title of the card.

      • getBodyText

        public java.lang.String getBodyText()

        Returns:
        A String that is currently set as the body text for this Card.
        See Also:
        setBodyText(java.lang.String)

      • setBodyText

        public void setBodyText(java.lang.String bodyText)

        Sets the body text of this CardData.

        This text will be used as the main content of this card. For example, for a Card representing a message, this would contain the actual text of the message.

        Parameters:
        bodyText - A String containing the main content text of this CardData.

        public void setCardClickIntent(android.content.Intent cardClickIntent,
                      boolean isBroadcast)

        Sets an Intent that will be launched when this Card is clicked in CM Home.

        Please note that Parcelable extras are not supported for this feature.

        Parameters:
        cardClickIntent - An Action or Broadcast Intent that will be launched when this card is clicked.
        isBroadcast - Is this Intent in cardClickIntent a Broadcast Intent?

      • setAction1Text

        public void setAction1Text(java.lang.String action1Text)
        Sets a String to be displayed on the first action button within the Card. This text should describe what this button will do, using a verb. For example, a news extension may have an action one button to share an article. This field could be set to "Share" for this button.
        Parameters:
        action1Text - A String to display on the first action button.

        action2Text - A String to display on the second action button.

      • getPriority

        public CardData.Priority getPriority()
        Gets the CardData.Priority for this CardData.
        Returns:
        A CardData.Priority describing the level of priority that this card has been assigned.

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(CardData.Priority priority)
        Sets a Priority value for this CardData. This is used to self report the priority of this card. Cards will be ordered in CM Home based on a combination of priority, time and other factors. The highest priority cards will be ordered first.
        Parameters:
        value - One of CardData.Priority.HIGH, CardData.Priority.MID, CardData.Priority.LOW.
        See Also:
        CardData.Priority

      • unpublish

        public boolean unpublish(android.content.Context context)
        Removes this CardData from the feed, so that it is no longer visible to the user.
        Overrides:
        unpublish in class PublishableCard
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the publishing application.
        Returns:
        True if the card was successfully unpublished, false otherwise.

      • getAllPublishedCardDatas

        public static java.util.List<CardData> getAllPublishedCardDatas(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves all published cards from this application that are available at the current time.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the publishing application.
        Returns:
        A List of all live, published cards in CM Home from this application.

      • createFromCurrentCursorRow

        public static CardData createFromCurrentCursorRow(android.database.Cursor cursor,
                                  java.lang.String authority)

        Creates a CardData object from a Database cursor that is set to a current row containing CardData data.

        This is intended to be an internal SDK method. Use .api.cards.CardData#getAllPublishedCards(Context) to retrieve cards.

        Parameters:
        cursor - A cursor that has been moved to a non-empty row that contains CardData data.
        authority - The authority of the CM Home extension ContentProvider that this CardData originated from.
        Returns:
        The CardData object represented in the current row of the input Cursor.
        See Also:
        getAllPublishedCardDatas(android.content.Context)

      • createFromCurrentCursorRow

        public static CardData createFromCurrentCursorRow(android.database.Cursor cursor)
        Creates a CardData object from a Database cursor that is set to a current row containing CardData data.

        This is intended to be an internal SDK method. Use .api.cards.CardData#getAllPublishedCards(Context) to retrieve cards.

        Parameters:
        cursor - A cursor that has been moved to a non-empty row that contains CardData data.
        Returns:
        The CardData object represented in the current row of the input Cursor.

      • getAllPublishedCardDatas

        public static java.util.List<CardData> getAllPublishedCardDatas(android.content.Context context,
                                                android.net.Uri cardDataContentUri,
                                                android.net.Uri cardDataImageContentUri)
        Retrieves a list of cards that are currently published for the given CardData Uri and CardDataImage Uri.

        This is intended to be an internal SDK method. You should use getAllPublishedCardDatas(Context)

        Parameters:
        context - A Context object to retrieve the ContentResolver.
        cardDataContentUri - The Content Uri containing the cards to query for.
        cardDataImageContentUri - The Content Uri containing the CardDataImage objects to query for.
        Returns:
        A list of CardData objects that are currently published.
